title: Post Malone is latest musical artist to embrace VR with live free Oculus concert Oct. 17
text:
Post Malone is latest musical artist to embrace VR with live free Oculus concert Oct. 17

CLOSE

'Rockstar' rapper Post Malone's Oct. 17 concert in Raleigh, N.C., can be watched live in virtual reality using Oculus VR headsets. (Photo: Oculus Venues/Supersphere)

Fans of Grammy-winning singer/rapper Post Malone can virtually attend his Oct. 17 gig in Raleigh, N.C., live via Oculus VR headsets.

Post Malone, whose album Hollywood's Bleeding currently holds the top spot on Billboard Top 200 album chart, is the latest headliner to take to VR.

Billie Eilish, Tenacious D, Vince Staples, The Revivalists, H.E.R., and Nathaniel Rateliff and the Night Sweats have also been some of the musical acts featured in the Oculus Venues app and produced by live VR provider Supersphere.

You can experience the concert for free on Oct. 17 at 8 p.m. ET with an Oculus Quest or Oculus Go headset. Sign up on the Oculus Venues event page (https://ocul.us/PostMalone).

Follow USA TODAY reporter Mike Snider on Twitter: @MikeSnider.

Read or Share this story: https://www.usatoday.com/story/tech/talkingtech/2019/10/03/post-malone-live-vr-concert-coming-oculus-oct-17/3850333002/
